result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Sarah Jessica Russell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 07/25/2016 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 
Cash bail to apply.

**Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successfully completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.
With credit for 2 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah Jessica Russell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund check packet
5/2/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

**Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement. Upon successfully completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

On Motion of the State,  Court ordered COUNTS 2 and 3 DISMISSED.  

As to COUNT 1:

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve TWO (2) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for TWO (2) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees BY 07-25-2016 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.  CASH BAIL TO APPLY.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  CASH BAIL TO APPLY.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense has passed Community Service along to the Case manager.  Defendant has completed the letter of apology.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Bail Bond Refund Packet

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter in Court for initial review hearing.  Defense advised the Court that Community Service will begin 12-16-2015.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to all counts;  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction withheld.  Parties enter into a deferred prosecution agreement which is approved by the court.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.
Filed with the court:  Victim Impact Statement  Review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for dpa hearing.  Defense awaiting final draft of agreement.  Joint request for adjournment granted by the Court.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for 10-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Case recalled.  Same appearances.
Court orders case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court that TAD evaluation is scheduled for today and request adjournment.
Court orders case passed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State and defense request on final adjournment granted by the court.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Any additional cash bail posted on this case to be returned to the remittur.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Garrett Y.   AND/OR   Kelly H.   AND/OR   Ralston S.    AND/OR   their residences    AND/OR  their places of employment
AND/OR  the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee campus grounds

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Sarah Jessica Russell in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-082

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  

As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty to both counts.

Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
